Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I'm 56, married, have 3 kids and grew up in the "space and rockets" era of the 1960's and 1970's.

I devour any books or video I can find about the US space program (even X1/X2 and X15 stuff), but mostly the Apollo program.

In 1989, I saw all three Apollo 11 astronauts in Oshkosh, Wisc. and had the honor of personally speaking briefly with Dr. Buzz Aldrin.

I'm an electrical engineer by day and a "Jack of all hobbies" guy by night.

I love photography, model airplanes, model rockets, guns (target shooting), electronics, computers, robotics... too many things to list.

I'm not much into computer gaming, but the Kerbal space game is the nuts! It's great fun because it's not just another shoot-em-up game... it requires thinking and imagination - and the physics of the "game", although not perfect, are quite realistic.

So, I hope to bother some of you for information and advice, as well as maybe contribute something to the game when I know enough about the insides of it.

That's all for now......

-- Roger
Welcome! May you be an explorer and not an exploder (most of the time)
